options.option_text: This Instructions is just for a reference & not for an evaluation.

questions.question_text_1: The time period of any wave is generally measured as the time interval between a positive peak and the succeeding negative peak.
question_texts: The time period of any wave is generally measured as the time interval between a positive peak and the succeeding negative peak.

questions.question_text_1: Voltage across an ideal inductor is zero if the current through it remains constant.
question_texts: Voltage across an ideal inductor is zero if the current through it remains constant.

questions.question_text_1: For an AC signal, the RMS (root-mean-square) value is always higher than its peak value.
question_texts: For an AC signal, the RMS (root-mean-square) value is always higher than its peak value.

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following circuits is not practical?
questions.question_text_2: Which of the following circuits is not practical?
question_texts: Which of the following circuits is not practical? Which of the following circuits is not practical?

questions.question_text_1: The value of the voltage source V3 (in V) is ______ V.
questions.question_text_2: The value of the voltage source V3 (in V) is ______ V.
question_texts: The value of the voltage source V3 (in V) is ______ V. The value of the voltage source V3 (in V) is ______ V.

questions.question_text_1: In a household, the following electrical appliances are used every day: • 4 bulbs, each rated at 30 W, operated for 5 hours • 4 tube lights, each rated at 50 W, operated for 8 hours • 1 air conditioner rated at 1000 W, operated for 1 hour Assume each appliance draws power continuously whenever it is switched ON. If 1 unit of electrical energy = 1 kWh, determine the total number of units of electrical energy consumed in a 30-day month.
question_texts: In a household, the following electrical appliances are used every day: • 4 bulbs, each rated at 30 W, operated for 5 hours • 4 tube lights, each rated at 50 W, operated for 8 hours • 1 air conditioner rated at 1000 W, operated for 1 hour Assume each appliance draws power continuously whenever it is switched ON. If 1 unit of electrical energy = 1 kWh, determine the total number of units of electrical energy consumed in a 30-day month.

questions.question_text_1: An ideal 1800 mAh battery is powering a load that draws a constant current of 60 mA. How long will the fully charged battery last before it drains completely?
question_texts: An ideal 1800 mAh battery is powering a load that draws a constant current of 60 mA. How long will the fully charged battery last before it drains completely?
